wk1_r1.prompt_text: Propose a minimal early-game pacing nudge that uses existing systems (bounties/lairs/spawner) and is deterministic.

response.raw:
### Status
Completed implementation of the wk1 plan’s minimal early-game pacing nudge using existing systems (HUD + bounties + lairs) and sim-time (determinism-friendly).

### Deliverables
- Early pacing nudge implementation: `game/engine.py`
  - Shows a HUD bounty tip (~35s sim-time) if the player hasn’t placed any bounties
  - At ~90s sim-time, optionally auto-places a starter `attack_lair` bounty on the nearest lair if the player placed none and can afford it (charges via `EconomySystem.add_bounty`; reward uses `LAIR_BOUNTY_COST`)
  - `attack_lair` bounties are completion-claimed on `lair_cleared` (not proximity-claimed)
- QA control: `EARLY_PACING_NUDGE_MODE` in `config.py` + CLI override `--early-nudge {auto,off,force}`
- Doc note tying this to scenarios: `docs/scenarios.md`

### Questions
- None.

### Next actions
- Verify QA can disable/force quickly and that force mode never triggers if any bounty already exists.

### Handoff checklist
- Files changed: `game/engine.py`, `config.py`, `main.py`, `docs/scenarios.md`
- How to test: run `python main.py --no-llm --early-nudge force` to see tip + starter bounty immediately (if no bounties exist). Use `--early-nudge off` to confirm it never fires. Default `auto` should behave ~35s/~90s.

New CLI arg/engine init parameter could break external scripts if they instantiate GameEngine positionally (should be low risk)
